com.samsung.android.sdk.professionalaudio

Class SapaService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.professionalaudio.SapaService

  • public final class SapaService
extends Object
    This class allows you to use the JACK functionality and to manage SapaProcessor instances.
    You can use this class to register or unregister a SapaProcessor instance (processing module plug-in).
    You can also use this class to communicate with the JACK service and to control the connection to the JACK service.

    You can either load one of the processing module plug-ins provided with the Professional Audio package or you can create your own custom processing module plug-in.
    When you register a SapaProcessor, the processing module runs as a new process.

    Since:
    Samsung Android JellyBean
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    HaeSeok Oh, LaeHyuk Bang, JeongYeon Kim, DaeBeom Park

      • isStarted

      • start

        public void start(int startParam)
           throws AndroidRuntimeException
        Start the service in the specified mode.
        Use this method to start the service before you register a SapaProcessor instance.

        Parameters:
        startParam - The start mode for the service.
        The startParam can be set as a bit-flag.
        The valid values are:
        START_PARAM_DEFAULT_LATENCY
        START_PARAM_EXCEPT_CAPTURE
        START_PARAM_HIGH_LATENCY
        START_PARAM_LOW_LATENCY
        START_PARAM_MID_LATENCY
        START_PARAM_USE_DUMMY
        For example, To start with default latency and no capture device, use start(START_PARAM_DEFAULT_LATENCY | START_PARAM_EXCEPT_CAPTURE).
        The valid values for latency settings are:
        START_PARAM_DEFAULT_LATENCY
        START_PARAM_LOW_LATENCY
        START_PARAM_MID_LATENCY
        START_PARAM_HIGH_LATENCY
        If invalid values are passed, they are ignored and the default latency is used. The default latency is the best quality latency that the device supports.

        To start without a capture device, use START_PARAM_EXCEPT_CAPTURE.
        To start in dummy mode, use START_PARAM_USE_DUMMY.
        Dummy mode means that the SapaService instance does not offer any system port.

        Throws:
        AndroidRuntimeException - Thrown if an error occurs while starting.
        See Also:
        stop(boolean)

      • stop

        public void stop(boolean force)
        Stop the service.
        Parameters:
        force - if false, stop the service when it is possible. if true, stop the service by force.
        See Also:
        start(int)

      • register

        public void register(SapaProcessor processor)
              throws InstantiationException
        Register the specified SapaProcessor instance with this SapaService instance.
        You can only use this method if the SapaService instance is running.
        Parameters:
        processor - The SapaProcessor instance to register.
        Throws:
        InstantiationException - Thrown if SapaProcessor fails to instantiate.
        Call SapaService.start() to start the service before calling this method.

      • unregister

        public void unregister(SapaProcessor processor)
        Unregister the specified SapaProcessor instance.
        Parameters:
        processor - The SapaProcessor instance to unregister.

      • setTransportTimeout

        public void setTransportTimeout(double timeout)
        Set the specified transport timeout.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout for the transport in seconds
        For example, setTransportTimeout(2.0) sets the transport timeout to 2 seconds.
